Detailed Description

The new AMS Tracker database class.

The TkDBc Class is a singleton, that is only one instance of this class is admitted. The TkDBc single instance is created via the static method TkDBc::CreateTkDBc() and is accessibile via the static pointer TkDBc::Head.
The access of to the ladder objects is done via the find functions that implement a fast binary search.

author P.Zuccon -- INFN Perugia 20/11/2007

Date:
2008/01/17 PZ First version

2008/01/21 SH File name, class name changed to avoid conflicts Some bugs are fixed

2008/01/23 SH Some comments are added

2008/02/02 SH New method GetTkId(x,y,z) added

2008/02/26 AO New method GetEntry() for TkId map added

short int TkDBc::_octant_crate[8]
 

Map of the crate number corresponting to the octants.

Octant are numbered the following way

NEGATIVE Y corresponds to RAM. POSITIVE Y corresponds to WAKE.

V Oct X Y Z Crate JINJ JMDC

(slave num) A B P S

0 or 1P + WAKE + T0 3 166 167 168 169 1 or 2M - WAKE + T1 9 170 171 172 173 2 or 3P + RAM + T3 1 178 179 180 181 3 or 4M - RAM + T2 0 174 175 176 177 4 or 5P + WAKE - T4 16 182 183 184 185 5 or 6M - WAKE - T5 17 186 187 188 189 6 or 7P + RAM - T7 23 194 195 196 197 7 or 8M - RAM - T6 22 190 191 192 193

Definition at line 177 of file TkDBc.h.

Referenced by GetCratePos(), TrParDB::init(), and init().

TkDBc * TkDBc::Head = 0 [static]
 

static pointer to the TkDBc singleton

The TkDBc data and methods are always accessibile via TkDBc::Head Example: TkDBc::Head->_nplanes or TkDBc::FindTkId(-212);
